measured_by: composite score derived from 12 ELSA cognitive tasks (orientation in time, word-list recall, prospective memory, numerical ability, counting backwards, object naming, serial 7’s subtraction, verbal fluency word-find, letter cancellation, number series, literacy task)
justification: “From these twelve cognitive function scores, we created a general IQ factor (i.e., composite score) which we refer to as ‘Phenotypic IQ’. This composite measure standardizes and then combines respondent's average scores… from each of the cognitive tasks.”

measured_by: polygenic score for IQ (PGS IQ) based on GWAS effect sizes from Savage et al., 2018
justification: “Our PGS for IQ… are based on the large GWAS summary statistics provided by Savage et al. 2018… individuals with higher polygenic scores for IQ tend to have higher phenotypic IQ.”

measured_by: polygenic score for educational attainment (PGS EA) based on GWAS effect sizes from Lee et al., 2018
justification: “We assess the relationship between forecasting errors and the polygenic score for educational attainment… Our PGS for… educational attainment are based on the large GWAS summary statistics provided by… Lee et al. (2018).”

measured_by: single probabilistic question: “What are the chances that you will live to be X or more?” (0–100 scale)
justification: “Specifically, ELSA asks all survey participants ‘What are the chances that you will live to be or more?’ … Responses are coded on a range from 0 to 100.”

measured_by: difference between individual’s subjective survival probability and actuarial probability from UK life tables (|SSP – OP|)
justification: “Our measure of belief miscalibration… is based upon FE = SSP – OP, where SSP is the subjective survival probability… and OP is the statistically derived true expected value based upon population life tables.”
